uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.function

Interface InvertibleFunction<T,R>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Operand type.
    R - Result type.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<T,R>

    public interface InvertibleFunction<T,R>
extends Function<T,R>
    Describes a function from F to T. A function should be stateless.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T,I,R> InvertibleFunction<T,R> compose(InvertibleFunction<T,I> first, InvertibleFunction<I,R> second) 
      InvertibleFunction<R,T> getInverse()
      This returns the mathematical inverse of the receiving function.
      static <T,R> InvertibleFunction<T,R> over(Function<? super T,? extends R> function, Function<? super R,? extends T> reverse) 

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Function

        andThen, apply, compose, identity

    • Method Detail

      • getInverse

        InvertibleFunction<R,T> getInverse()
        This returns the mathematical inverse of the receiving function.
        Returns:
        A new Invertible function performing the inverse operation.

      • over

        static <T,R> InvertibleFunction<T,R> over(Function<? super T,? extends R> function,
                                          Function<? super R,? extends T> reverse)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The operand type of the forward function, and the result type of its reverse.
        R - The result type of the forward function, and the operand type of its reverse.
        Parameters:
        function - The function in forward direction.
        reverse - The reverse of the function.
        Returns:
        An invertible function using the two given functions.

      • compose

        static <T,I,R> InvertibleFunction<T,R> compose(InvertibleFunction<T,I> first,
                                               InvertibleFunction<I,R> second)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The operand type of the first function.
        I - An intermediate type which the result type of the first function can be assigned to, and which can assign to the operand type of the second function.
        R - The result type of the second function.
        Parameters:
        first - The first function to compose.
        second - The second function to compose.
        Returns:
        Composition of two invertible functions into a single invertible function.
